lead_paragraph: ERDELL--Paquita de Leon, EdD, RD (retired) of Manhattan passed away on February 23, 2015, in her 91st year. She completed her BS in Dietetics and Institutional Management, Pratt Institute, New York; MA, Professional Diploma in Nutrition and Public Health, and EdD at Teachers College, Columbia University, New York. She was a Registered Dietitian at St. Luke's Hospital in New York City and was one of the earliest renal dietitians. Of Guatemalan descent, Paquita partnered in 1996 to fund the First International Nutritionist/Dietitian (FIND) Fellowship for Study in the USA at the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (formerly the American Dietetics Association) Foundation. FIND continues to be awarded annually to a foreign national for postgraduate work with the clearly articulated plan to bring knowledge and training back to their home country. A memorial service will be held February 28, 2016, the Church of Notre Dame, 5:30pm. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  ERDELL, PAQUITA DE LEON

Of Guatemalan descent, Paquita partnered in 1996 to fund the First International Nutritionist/Dietitian (FIND) Fellowship for Study in the USA at the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (formerly the American Dietetics Association) Foundation.
